Key Match Events: Andrew Wiggins finished with 24 points, three assists and four steals to lead the Warriors to a 121-113 win.
Dennis Schroder had 17 points and nine assists, while Lindy Waters III provided 16 points off the bench.
Desmond Bane had 22 points, 10 assists and two steals for the Grizzlies, but also had eight turnovers.
Jaren Jackson Jr. contributed 23 points and nine rebounds, while Jake LaRavia scored 17 points and provided nine assists off the bench.
Pre-Game Insights: Ja Morant missed his fourth straight game with a sprained shoulder.
Steph Curry was rested due to knee issues.
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State won their first back-to-back since Nov. 22, which showed how much they needed the win.
Memphis has now lost two in a row and dropped to third in the Western Conference standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two teams are without their best players in Ja Morant and Steph Curry, respectively, due to injuries.
